revised_title: Sulphur Bacteria: Physiology and Ecological Roles of Thiobacilli and Other Sulphur-Oxidizing Bacteria
tldr: This article discusses the diverse group of sulfur-oxidizing bacteria, including obligate chemolithotrophs, facultative chemolithotrophs, and heterotrophic bacteria. It explores their physiology, metabolism, and ecological roles in various environments. The study focuses on the sulfur-oxidizing chemolithotrophs, their energy generation from the oxidation of reduced inorganic sulfur compounds, and their interactions with other organisms and the environment.
